The most studied semiconducting material from the family of transition-metal monosilicides is FeSi. Our calculated value of
ϵ g
is similar to results from [ 23, 83]. Theoretical
ϵ g
is approximately twice larger than experimental values 0.054–0.06 eV [ 27, 28, 29]. As is apparent from the following discussion, this overestimation is connected with the effects of dynamical electronic correlations.
